Sentencas: A hierarchical multi-physics continuum model is used to investigate syngas (H-2 + CO) production in a solid oxide button cell, single repeating unit and cell stack.
Titulo: Hierarchical modeling of solid oxide cells and stacks producing syngas via H2O/CO2 Co-electrolysis for industrial applications

Sentencas: A novel cluster algorithm and pseudo-homogenous approach enables a computationally efficient model scale-up from 1-D button cells to 3-D stacks with minimal loss of information across the scales.
Titulo: Hierarchical modeling of solid oxide cells and stacks producing syngas via H2O/CO2 Co-electrolysis for industrial applications

Sentencas: The model agrees well with polarization, temperature and outlet gas composition measurements made by Fu et al.
Titulo: Hierarchical modeling of solid oxide cells and stacks producing syngas via H2O/CO2 Co-electrolysis for industrial applications

Sentencas: on single Ni-GDC vertical bar YSZ vertical bar ISM-YSZ cells [ECS Transactions 35, 2949-2956 (2011)].
Titulo: Hierarchical modeling of solid oxide cells and stacks producing syngas via H2O/CO2 Co-electrolysis for industrial applications

Sentencas: After, the model generates 3-D contour plots to map the performance of a single repeating unit of a F-design stack from Forschungszentrum Julich
Titulo: Hierarchical modeling of solid oxide cells and stacks producing syngas via H2O/CO2 Co-electrolysis for industrial applications

Titulo: Hierarchical modeling of solid oxide cells and stacks producing syngas via H2O/CO2 Co-electrolysis for industrial applications

Sentencas: Over the range of conditions studied, the overall efficiency and syngas yield increases with residence time though beyond a threshold value, reactant starvation leads to a decrease in efficiency and a greater propensity for Ni coking.
Titulo: Hierarchical modeling of solid oxide cells and stacks producing syngas via H2O/CO2 Co-electrolysis for industrial applications

Sentencas: Increasing the operating temperature shifts peak efficiencies to lower voltages and the performance of the repeating unit is nearly identical for the two H-2:CO ratios studied.
Titulo: Hierarchical modeling of solid oxide cells and stacks producing syngas via H2O/CO2 Co-electrolysis for industrial applications

Sentencas: On scaling up to produce a commercial quantity of syngas, shorter stacks lead to lower capital costs and smaller electrolyzer areas while running at lower velocities has the opposite effect although it minimizes temperature gradients.
Titulo: Hierarchical modeling of solid oxide cells and stacks producing syngas via H2O/CO2 Co-electrolysis for industrial applications

Sentencas: Stack simulation over a wide range of operating regimes, including pure H2O and CO2 electrolysis, divulges the time constants of charge, mass and heat transport.
Titulo: Hierarchical modeling of solid oxide cells and stacks producing syngas via H2O/CO2 Co-electrolysis for industrial applications
